name: Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians
description: Awakened from his slumber, Beatbuddy journeys through lush hand-painted environments on a quest to save his companions and his own immortality. Beatbuddy interacts with the living breathing environment that pulses to the beat of an original soundtrack, aiding him as he unlocks new paths and solves puzzles.
minimum_requirements: 最低配備: 作業系統: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8 處理器: 1.8 GHz (dual core) 記憶體: 2 GB 記憶體 顯示卡: 256 MB NVidia or ATI graphics card, Intel HD Graphics 3000 or better DirectX: 版本：9.0c 儲存空間: 1 GB 可用空間

reviews.review_text: I can absolutely recommend this game. I agree in a way with the sluggish controls many reviewers describe but they rarely keep me from really enjoying this game. They just become part of the challenge and I feel you can master them without being too irritated about it. The pure fun and enjoyment of simple but groovy gameplay is all worth it though and the puzzles do progress the further you go. I've been playing this game with my projector on a 100 inch scale and the visuals and detail in the art are mind-blowing. At times it's like an lsd-trip.  This game was completely worth it for me.  If you're not sure, just get it in a sale, you won't regret it.

Beatbuddy is a cool game. It is not very difficult as long as you keep to the beat. The level design is cute and the main character evolves with some new abilities to keep floating to its goal. The music is also entertaining and is definitely a big part in the game.

Although lots of people think this puzzle game isn't hard at all and the music sometimes just become annoying while players stay in a scene for a long time, I would still recommend this game. First of all, with the beat music here, I say the developer team has a good intention to make the undersea lively and they succeed. The scenes of undersea here aren't dark and quiet but lively and bright. The design of the stages with the concept of the beat sound from objects which are interative and those which aren't have their own styles. Second, the puzzles here are simple. However, the standard about difficulty of puzzles is different based on players' different gaming experience and the experience they're seeking from thie game. To me, puzzle games don't have to be hard to challenge but simple to relax myself.So, in my opinion, if you don't want to beat it one day after playing several hours but just relax yourself by playing games, it's good for you, too. Last but not least, the game will be around 2 bucks on sale, which is pretty cheap to get. If you're pretty sure that this game is your type or at least you won't hate this game, I would say it's worth the price with the hours you spend enjoying youself.

I haven't played it for too long, but I can already say this game is amazing! The environment is beautiful and feels so alive since it is always a part of the music, which, is outstanding in itself as well as the way it fits the game. The characters all feel unique and the obstacles are all engaging enough to keep you interested. It's a well executed game and all you have to do is watch the trailer to get the need for this game.

Pretty cool game. Plays like a puzzle platformer but without the platforming, since you swim about freely. Kind of like a simpler Aquaria without the Metroid structure.  While a lot of the gameplay is governed by the rhythm of the music, I don't find that this sets the game terribly much apart from platformers with timing-heavy challenges, such as Donkey Kong Country. Rather, the main draw here is Beatbuddy's personality and soundtrack: every time a character speaks, the text box is backgrounded by a different beatboxing track, and, as you move through the stages, the music changes in complexity depending upon what's happening around you.  This sense that features of the level design are actually creating the music doesn't seem as potent or as 1:1 as in some other games that have done similar, most notably 140, but the music itself is good. Beatbuddy isn't going to blow your mind, but it's an enjoyable experience overall and well worth picking up at a sale price.
If you like action adventure games and to hear good music at the same time. Don`t miss this!!! Awesome game!!!!
It's a really cute game.
I bought the game for music.

Absolutely unique idea of controls acting to the music, mindblowing beautiful handdrawn levels, cool music (ofcourse you have to like the style) and the story is funny and shows some nice ideas too! Well done!

Apart from that level 3 bug with organ, level 4 part 3 bug, and bug in final level I dearly did enjoy this game, be prepare for restarting levels a lot. In this game music is made by objects that you are also interacting with. Not frustratingly difficult, even if you are not fan of puzzle games. Game is playable but there is no point for gathering extras if you have to restart from checkpoint and lose all gems collected so far.

If you enjoy rhythm games, good music, or beautiful worlds this game won't let you down.  Pros: The music is amazing Visuals are stunning Story is fun Controls are great regardless of if you're using a controller or mouse/keyboard Gameplay is addicting  Cons: A bit short, 2-4 hours or less to complete the story Some of the puzzles are repeatitive
The best underwater level you'll ever play.
Chill puzzle game with great soundtrack. Cool animations and mechanics, especially idling and moving with the vehicle.
Love this game, all though challenging at time's and frustrating ,it's fun to play and the art work is fantastic,beatbuddy is a very cute game love it.
Dance baby dance!!!  Without the music, it could be a boring game...

I just couldn't get into it. Everything desirable is accounted for in the game, and somebody else may like it, but it just didn't do anything for me. Meh. Not Thumbs downing it though, because they seem to have done a good job with it.

This game is definitely a great game in my eyes. Its got tons of fun levels,unique music,and is overall,a cool game. I've followed it for a while,and when I played it,it was amazing. Deserves at least a 9/10.
As someone who has been beating their buddy since they were 12 years old, this game was not quite was I expecting.
Great music, nicely designed. A really fun game!
Little fun game! You find an adventure and on the way your music...
This game really has a great beat.
This is a really interesting take on a rhythm game and is really fun to play. Bought this on sale thinking I'd give it a try and definitely blew me away. Really fun and creative game.

Liked the game, but didn't love it.  PRO: +The Music fits perfectly into the atmosphere. + Times flies by. I didn't notice that 1 Level took me like 30 minutes.  Felt more like ~10-15. + You get the feel for the rhythm of the game pretty quick.  CON: - Some parts are really(!) frustrating because the timeframes to do certain tasks are VERY short. - It's sometimes hard to controll in some areas. - Here and there you can't enjoy the athmosphere because obstacles screw you over.  SUMMARY:  Here and there frustrating but all in all it's a decent game. Might take you some time to get into it, but if you have a drill, time flies. 6.5/10.
Nice puzzle game with awesome music.

Beatbuddy is a game which blends music and gameplay elements into an exciting arcade-style game. Of the many indie games I've played this one is definitly engaging due to its art and gamplay. Given the price and the value this game provides I'd reccomend it at a 8/10.
Love it, Abosolutely Love it. Would Buy for a dollar again!!!!
I have no rhythm. This game makes me sad. It is a good game. But I can't dance.
Super fun and addicting. The soundtrack is really good too!

Liked the game, but didn't love it.  PRO: +The Music fits perfectly into the atmosphere. + Times flies by. I didn't notice that 1 Level took me like 30 minutes.  Felt more like ~10-15. + You get the feel for the rhythm of the game pretty quick.  CON: - Some parts are really(!) frustrating because the timeframes to do certain tasks are VERY short. - It's sometimes hard to controll in some areas. - Here and there you can't enjoy the athmosphere because obstacles screw you over.  SUMMARY:  Here and there frustrating but all in all it's a decent game. Might take you some time to get into it, but if you have a drill, time flies. 6.5/10.

Incredibly intelligent, superbly catchy, and with tunes like this, that are integrated with the game, how could you possibly not love this Indie gem! For a platformer game, it's definitely bringing back nostalgic memories. Amazing graphics, smooth, immersive gameplay. Definitely recommend for those who enjoy a rythm or two with a platformer style!

This game is pretty good. Its got some interesting mechanics and music, but I wouldn't necessarily call it 'fun'. It's interesting, cool to listen to, and occasionally hits you with waves of fun (specifically, when the music is playing, and something fast paced is happening); however, occasionally it starts to lose pace, and that's where it shines a little less. I feel like a faster tempo was their strong suite, and those moments came a bit too few and far between.  That being said. Definitely worth the play: if not fun all the time, its enjoyable.
It's a very interesting game. Nothing really feels gimmicky. Maybe it's just me, but it got repetitive really fast. But who knows, it might be right for you.
This is one of those games I would never have looked twice at - got in in a Humble Bundle. Seriously though, one of the most unique games I've ever played. This thing is absolutely wonderful.

Very charming sidescroller. This is all about the beat, the music, the rythm. Simple mechanics with a chibi art style. Very simple puzzles as you swim around heading through a simple story, point by point, beat by beat. This is exceptionally good for short 10-30 minute stretches of gameplay that will set you in a good mood.

9/10 game. Follows every concept of good game design.  The way music is used to both create and let you create the world, atmosphere, and story, is so simple, so basic, but executed so effectively. It's simply too enjoyable and immersive!  The difficulty scales really well until the last level, which feels a bit less difficult than the level before it, which was kind of disappointing.  The story is really engaging due to how your actions affect the world. The game is extremely linear, but you really do feel like what you do in each level is determining your progression—uuuuuuuuuup until the game's climax, which was really unsatisfying. Despite that, though, the gameplay picked up the slack.  All in all, I highly recommend this game. It kept me engaged throughout the single session I played, in which I completed the game. Extremely fun and enjoyable!
beautifull and charming game, which has stunning aesthetics and an amazing sound which fits in perfectly!
I've never played something like this before! Simple and easy, but the gaming experience is incredible with the soundtrack. I got it from a Humble Bundle and totally worth it.
Its unique soundtrack makes Beatbuddy: Tale of the Guardians a truely lovely game.

The world of beatbuddy is based upon elecroswingish music. Various elements of the world 'play' different instruments and so the level environment progressively increases or decreases the music as you progress. To interact with certain elemtns you have to keep up with the rhythm and time your actions right. At times there are labyrinths and logic puzzles to be solved.  Despite a few bugs my playthrough suffered on, which seem never to be fixed but could be found on google and worked around, it is a fun game.

Beatbuddy is common puzzle game. And it's not great. But, this game's soundtrack is epic! And gameplay is mixed with this awesome ost. You can move the character to the rhythm and powerful beat comes from the behavior of character. It's all very excited experience. Although pure gameplay is not that good and playtime is very short(about 4 hours), this game's soundtrack is so terrific. Totally worth to play.

Nice looking visuals with great music and interesting gameplay features.  Unfortunately it suffers from quite a few performance issues and bugs in the version I've played (patch 2) but hopefully there will be more fixes in the future and also the game is very very short, I would probably have completed it in less than 4 hours on my first playthrough if it wasn't for the performance issues and how difficult it is to control with my terrible gamepad..

I've always loved games that manage to integrate the soundtrack into the gameplay. The controls are a bit iffy at times as a result, but it's definitely a unique experience. And the soundtrack is pretty rockin' too!

Pros: - Great soundtrack. You just can't stop your foot from tapping the floor while playing this game. I'm listening to Beatbuddy soundtrack even after finished the game - Artwork looks very neat. Concept art and developer notes show us how much work you have to do for the beauty which Beatbuddy is.  Cons: - Game is actually short. I don't know how long it takes to finish the game, but after you did you feel unpleased. - Controls. I think best controls are with mouse only if your keyboard can't stand ghosting (for this game you often need to click 3 buttons at once). Mouse isn't great either, especially when you have to pick/drop an object... - Big SnareMonsters or whatever they're called. Just hate those things. I got bumped by it many times by them. If you can avoid swimming with them, just do it or you'll get ♥♥♥♥♥♥.  Well, more cons than pros, but still I think this game is great and you should look forward into buying it when it comes on sale.

I really love this game. It kinda sucks that the levels can feel really long (I keep expecting a 5 or 10 minute level), but I love the music and the gameplay is very simple and casual too. I'd highly suggest this game for people who wanna play a quick 30min-1 hour game that has good game play elements, and kinda interesting characters and very interesting gameplay mechanics and amazing music.

A very charming beat-keeping puzzle game. Gorgeous art, fluid animation and a killer soundtrack that changes depending on what's on screen. Everything keeps to the beat, from the pulsating plants to the animations of the main character.  The puzzles within are simple, yet challenging enough to keep you playing, and often rely on matching the beat to succeed. The game is controlled entirely with the mouse, so laptop gamers and people with no sense of rhythm need not apply. Other than that, I can highly recommend this.

Before anyone says it, I know I have not spent much time in this game as of the writing of this review.  ***  I am in love with this game. As a producer, musician, and lover of music, this game appeals to me in many ways. I love music-based games (see Cosmophony for Wii U/Android/iOS, Guitar Hero, etc.), and I love quirky indie games that have charm in their premise, and this game has both.  The fact that the platforming and the puzzles are based around the individual drums in the beat (hi-hat, bassdrum, snare) is a cool idea, and it appeals to me as a musician. Beat is a cute character, and the art style is vibrant and visually pleasing. The art is pretty, and the underwater theme is rather well executed. I don't really have anything bad to say about this game, but maybe that's my bias as a musician speaking.  I got this game on a Humble Bundle, and I most definitely do not regret getting that bundle for this game alone.
You can't beat it, buddy.

Beatbuddy has some really great music and beautiful art, but its puzzles are unfortunately very repetitive, and its checkpoint system has some major flaws: at one point in the game, it checkpointed immediately before my death, so every time I died, it would reload to a second or two before my death just for me to die again. I had to restart the entire level.  It also has some flaws with collection. You can pick chapters within each level, which would be great, if it would actually count each chapter's collections seperately, but as it is, if you want to collect all beat points in a level, you must play through the entire level.  However, even with these flaws, the sountrack, the art, and the interesting level design and exploration is enjoyable enough to give it a try. Buy it on sale to enjoy it the most, but it is worth full price.
Drop the Beat ! Drop the Beat ! This game is Neat !   Seriously now though, buy it if you love a good adventure game with a incredible rythm music that works accordingly to the game`s eviroment !

With a brilliant soundtrack and fun characters, I absolutely recommend this game. Everything in the environments of this game behave in accordance to the beat of the music, and it's executed really well.  The story is fine. Nothing groundbreaking, but it doesn't need to be. The writing is still solid, and the puzzles are well crafted and appropriately challenging. Give this game a shot for something fun and different.

I can't recommend this game at full price. Fun for the first couple levels, then gets tedious and repetitive. Several level breaking bugs on the last couple levels of the game that require complete restarts, buggy controls (using xobx 360), final game breaking bug that doesn't fix even with restart on last level keeping me from being able to complete the story. The soundtrack is good, along with the level backgrounds, and overall aesthetic but I found myself just trying to finish for the sake of finishing rather than because I was having fun. Couple this with the numerous bugs I ran into and I can't justify $10. Pick it up for $2-$3 or less to have a little fun. Other than that save your money. Mediocre at best. 3/5

A shame games cannot be reviewed just for their art.[/i]    Beatbuddy is a 2D exploration game with the whole game universe based on Music. The presentation is really creative, and the art original. The worlds are varied (with the exception of enemies only two in the entire game...) the Musc is very enjoyable and the fact that it builds up as you explore further gives a really gratifying feeling.  However while the artsy part of the game is great, the 'Game' part really doesn't keep up. For starters the narator has a tendency to mimic DJ scratching when he speaks. While it is a very interesting idea the result of it are cutscenes that are painfully long because of him, delaying any sense of conclusion at each and every sentence. Thank god they appear only rarely in the game. The whole game is underwater which makes it impossible to have granular control. You'll often find yourself restarting mutiple times parts where very precise tasks are required to be done in very little time. Furthermore as you don't gain short invulnerability when hit and enemies love to push you around when they hit you  will  find yourself being bounced about to your inevitable death. This happenning quite often it is one of the main reason while you will start cursing the game for not being forgiving. Level design is not very well thought out either, you will often find yourself trying to find out why you can't go there, if you are actually supposed to be there and stuck because you went somewhere you weren't supposed to be. All these issues lead to a hot mess of frustration and anger, powerless against a game that punishes you for being to curious. And it really is a shame that the actual gameplay is the worst part of the game, leaving what otherwise would've been a enjoyable experiment.  Even though BeatBuddy has the looks of a fun rythm/exploration game, it's faulty game mechanics and ill conceived levels put an swift end to any enjoyable experience. Therefore I cannot recommend this game.
Pros: * Good music. * An underwater setting, which isn't common in games. Cons: * Repetitive gameplay that gets old fast. * An extremely forgettable story and cast of characters.
The game is boring. Music is good.

5 minutes into the game. Already kinda annoyed by the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ weird ♥♥♥ beatboxxing whenever anyone speaks. More ♥♥♥♥♥♥ beatboxxing. More ♥♥♥♥♥♥/boring gameplay.  This is literally the only game ive installed to uninstall the next day.
This game has some frustrating moments caused by bad control scheme paired with horribly slow camera

Way too many bugs. Sometimes its a matter of just leaving the game and returning. Other times you had to restart the entire level. Finally got to the point where the annoyance level exceeded the fun level. Otherwise its not a bad game. If they ever fix all the bugs I might return to it.

It's not an overall terrible game, but it is incredibly tedious. The puzzles are bland and after the first fifteen times you bounce off plants after aligning a couple drum-things, it gets rather boring. Plus I encountered game breaking bugs like when, during a chase scene in Chapter Two, I could not shoot through the pillars to escape the giant fish head. There was also the time my character disappeared from the screen entirely, and I had to restart the game. It does have a nice feature where, if your computer has changeable colored lights on the front, they will pulse and change color with the music and environment.  I did not finish this game, as I could not proceed past the aforementioned bug, and it was getting repetitive. Maybe the puzzles (and music) get more varied as you go on, but I don't feel compelled enough to find out.  C- I felt this game had some interesting mechanics, but they weren't fleshed out enough. Plus, game stopping bugs.
Maybe it's just me, but felt kinda boring.
After half an hour I got all my card drops and no interest to continue this game. Only turn it on if you got it from a Humble Bundle, don't play it.

Awful game. Please don't waste your money on this one. It's like a rhythmic version of Ecco the Dolphin with terrible cutscenes, boring gameplay and overlong stages. The soundtrack is nice, but that's pretty much all the game has going for it.

Beatbuddy is not a particularly bad game but in the mass of good and fun indie games it is not worth recommending. The music and the rhythm-based gameplay are kind of fun but in general I think this game is a bit too long (not really motivating as it's not really challenging or rewarding)

The art reminds me of Aquaria. It's a passable game. The best part is the music. Using a controller is better than the mouse. I didn't try keyboard. It's really easy to get caught on edges as you're trying to dash past the insta-kill guys so you'll have to replay the same bits several times before you can continue. I think the game tries to be a puzzle game, but there are no puzzles. It's more frustrating than fun.
Pro: nice music, nice sync between the surroundings and the music  Cons: boring levels that seem out of place with the caracters.
5/10 Casual, repetitive, meh.

The game seemed fun for the first 3 levels but after that it all went downhill. The controls felt really weird through out the game and I never got the hang of driving the vehicle. I just rammed through everything. Few bugs here and there and bad design choises overall gave a bad impression. The art was okay mostly, but didn't strike as something I would remember. Though sometimes the art cluttered the screen so that I didn't see anything I was doing. Too much stuff going on on the screen. Characters were good, but not used much, so the story was very thin. Most of the time I wasn't sure what was going on. Level design didn't help when I was just pushing one way without knowing what I'm supposed to do next or where I'm going. The game just wasn't fun to play and the beat/music part felt sometimes superimposed. The soundtrack was good though.

Couldn't finish the game due to a bug (Linux). I had finished about half of the game when I needed to pass though a section that made my game crash (other users reported the same bug in the discussion board). Also I didn't like the game's style and considered the music to be monotonous (didn't enjoy it honestly). While it may be cheap, I can't recommend spending time playing this game.

strangely enough, this game is more of a typical 2D puzzler than it is a rhythm game. in fact, i did often find myself doing worse when i tried to follow the beat in some parts instead of just hitting the dash button and speeding forward.  there seems to be a lot of these 2D swimming/flying-through-dark-caves, and im not sure how original the concept is as a whole by now. all i know is that the environments and obstacles in this game lack variety in many cases, and it honestly failed to keep me engaged for all that long. not to mention the reaaaally irritating NPC sound loops ughhh  imo, Crypt of the NecroDancer is a much better example of how to merge a genre with a rhythm game, but i dunno. maybe i'm just picky
